Class ec.cosm.debug.DebugTopic 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class ec.cosm.debug.DebugTopic 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.cosm.debug.DebugTopic
public class DebugTopic
extends Object
Class representing debug tracing for a single topic. A topic has a string name identifying a subsystem being debugged (e.g. "io" or "presentation").

You can set the priority threshold and output stream just for this debug topic. You can also use it to access the Trace objects for the topic's different priority levels

USE_DEFAULT_THRESHOLD
Use this as an argument to setThreshold if you want to use the default priority threshold

getOutput()
Return output stream
getThreshold()
Return priority threshold
getTopic()
Return topic for this DebugTopic
getTrace(int)
Return trace object; this trace object can be used to actually print error messages at the given priority.
setOutput(OutputStream)
Set output stream.
setOutputFile(String)
Set output file; like setOutput but opens a buffered stream to the given file.
setThreshold(int)
Set priority threshold for this topic.

USE_DEFAULT_THRESHOLD 
  public final static int USE_DEFAULT_THRESHOLD
Use this as an argument to setThreshold if you want to use the default priority threshold

getTopic 
  public String getTopic()
Return topic for this DebugTopic
setThreshold 
  public synchronized void setThreshold(int priority)
Set priority threshold for this topic. If priority is USE_DEFAULT_THRESHOLD this topic will use the default priority, as set by Debug.setDefaultThreshold().
getThreshold 
  public int getThreshold()
Return priority threshold
setOutput 
  public synchronized void setOutput(OutputStream output)
Set output stream. Setting the output stream to null means use the default output stream, as set by Debug.setDefaultOutputStream(). If stream argument is not a print stream, a new print stream is wrapped round it.
setOutputFile 
  public void setOutputFile(String filename) throws IOException
Set output file; like setOutput but opens a buffered stream to the given file. If 'filename' is "stdout" or "stderr" output is sent to the standard output or error stream.
getOutput 
  public PrintStream getOutput()
Return output stream
getTrace 
  public Trace getTrace(int priority)
Return trace object; this trace object can be used to actually print error messages at the given priority. The DebugTopic ensures that the tracer is only enabled when it should be.
